private_information: I hold disks A,B,C,D,E from top to bottom where A is smallest and E is largest
left_peg.goal: Accurately report my local stack and the legal top-disk moves I can perform to the orchestrator.

middle_peg.goal: Accurately report my local stack (empty) and the legal top-disk moves I can perform to the orchestrator.

right_peg.goal: Accurately report my local stack (empty) and the legal top-disk moves I can perform to the orchestrator.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate local reports and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance by moving the stack from left to right following the rules.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 5 disks labeled A,B,C,D,E from smallest (A) to largest (E).
Only one disk can be moved at a time and a move consists of taking the top disk from one peg and placing it on top of another peg.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E; middle and right are empty.
Goal configuration: right peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E; left and middle are empty.

report.system_prompt: You are the left peg agent. Provide an accurate machine-readable description of your local stack and the single-disk moves you can currently perform. Do not generate PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is left_peg. You have the following private information: {agents->left_peg->private_information}. The public facts about the puzzle are: {environment->public_information}. Describe your current stack as an ordered list top-to-bottom and list each legal move of the form 'move <disk> from left to <peg>'. Keep the response concise and machine-readable.

report.system_prompt: You are the middle peg agent. Provide an accurate machine-readable description of your local stack and the single-disk moves you can currently perform. Do not generate PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is middle_peg. You have the following private information: {agents->middle_peg->private_information}. The public facts about the puzzle are: {environment->public_information}. Describe your current stack as an ordered list top-to-bottom and list each legal move of the form 'move <disk> from middle to <peg>'. Keep the response concise and machine-readable.

report.system_prompt: You are the right peg agent. Provide an accurate machine-readable description of your local stack and the single-disk moves you can currently perform. Do not generate PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is right_peg. You have the following private information: {agents->right_peg->private_information}. The public facts about the puzzle are: {environment->public_information}. Describe your current stack as an ordered list top-to-bottom and list each legal move of the form 'move <disk> from right to <peg>'. Keep the response concise and machine-readable.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator and an expert in creating PDDL domains and problems for the FastDownwards planner. Using the local reports from the peg agents, produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encodes the Tower of Hanoi instance. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure predicates, objects, initial state, and goal are explicit and suitable for FastDownwards. Keep agent actions and moves explicit as operators.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. The goal is: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Here are the public facts: {environment->public_information}. Here are the local reports you received: {state_left} {state_middle} {state_right}. Integrate these reports, resolve naming if necessary, and produce a PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that solves the instance. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
